result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Galvan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $54.28 per month commencing 02-01-2016 and each month thereafter.  Defendant to serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.  Defendant must make 9 monthly payments no early payment allowed.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of the sentence, payment of all costs and fees and no new criminal law violations.

To perform 40 additional hours.
06/06/18 PER HEARING, COURT APPLIES JAIL CREDIT TOWARDS FULFILLMENT OF COMMUNITY SERVICE. CS IS DEEMED SATISFIED.
Buy Money for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit previously paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew P Galvan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew P Galvan in court, in custody.  Lesli S Boese and Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court calls the case to address the defendant's non completion of court ordered community service.  The court quashes the capias and the court amends the judgment of conviction, applying the jail credit and deems community service satisified .  The defendant to pay the buy money and is to petition the court for expungement.  The defendant is to be released forthwith.
Bail/bond hearing on June 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew P Galvan in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has completed 31 of the 40 required hours of court ordered community service and requests additional time to complete the additional hours.  The Court grants the request and will allow additional time for the Defendant to complete the community service.  If the Defendant files written proof with the Court prior to the 1/3/17 hearing the hearing will be removed from the courts calendar.  Review hearing scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew P Galvan in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following: FINE: $473.50 to be paid at $54.28 per month commencing 2/1/16 or serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.  The Defendant must make the 9 monthly payments no early payments.
RESTITUITON: BUY MONEY $50.00 to be paid immediately following court to District Attrorney's Office/Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit.  Community Service: Perform 40 hours.    Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
